cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles east of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: slowly moving west-southwest over coastal North Carolina today, then drifting west across eastern South Carolina before turning northward across the western Carolinas and central Appalachians early next week toward the Mid-Atlantic/Northeast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Warning extends from north of Duck, NC to Cape Charles Light, VA and in Chesapeake Bay south of New Point Comfort (well south of Baltimore).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from South Santee River, SC to Duck, NC including Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds; Storm Surge Warning from South Santee River, SC to Duck, NC.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impact zone is the North Carolina and northern South Carolina coasts with secondary inland impacts spreading into South Carolina, western North Carolina, Virginia, and portions of the Mid-Atlantic including Maryland.
weather_observation.wind: Only a very low risk (≤4% cumulative) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 25-35 mph possible Sunday–Monday as the weakened circulation passes west of the Chesapeake.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge threat for the upper Chesapeake Bay; surge warnings end south of New Point Comfort, well south of Baltimore.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate to locally heavy rain Sunday through Monday (2–4 inches possible) could produce ponding on docks and minor tidal back-up in drainage systems.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Inland flooding upstream along the Susquehanna and Potomac basins could lead to high river flows in the Bay later next week, affecting barge traffic and reducing bridge clearances.
